storyInfo: Bagpipe and Horn go to the interrogation room at the appointed time, but come up empty. The barracks have kept them out of the loop, and executed the suspect without trial.

attributes.content: County Hillock...
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: A medium-sized nomadic city, a modest distance out from Londinium. Main pillars are agriculture and light industry, not on closest terms with the surrounding counties...
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Full match to what the intel describes.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Outcast, you there yet?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Just made it a minute ago. Did you slap a tracking device on me?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I've called you like fifteen times since last night!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I took the wasteland route. As if I'd have signal.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: *Sigh*. Okay. Let me get this out there, I'm not the one in a rush. Misery's pushing it.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You know how he is, the worrywart. Not my fault he can't chill out. He's all wound up, even out on a mission, it's like, is he looking to sprout some more wrinkles?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: —Wouldn't be Misery if he was anybody else.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Fair enough. Seriously, though, any thoughts on the city?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Extremely normal.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Intel might be faulty, then? There's at least thirty, forty-ish cities in Victoria at that scale—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No matter how bright the Londinium sun shines, there'll always be places its light can't reach.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You've seen the files. You should know County Hillock doesn't have any noble at the reins. Two counts showed interest in the city, but never saw it through.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Err... because it won't make any money?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yeah, or because of how ordinary it is.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: But the more normal a place looks, the better it is to hide in plain sight. No matter when Rhodes Island decides to get moving, this is a good opportunity to scout the way ahead.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Gotcha. Just call me if you need support. I only just geared up to head for Connor County. I'm still close by for now.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Resettling Infected's not easy work. I'm on basic chore duty compared to your mission, probably down at the branch office drinking tea more than half the time.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Gimme a break. With a storm like this coming, is a Sankta like you gonna be happy chilling with a cup of tea?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Ugh. You know, I'd love to live it up like a retiree.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Wonder why I'm not convinced...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Whatever, let's just all get our jobs done and head home soon as we can. Unrelated, Outcast, but I remember a bunch of green Sankta Operators waiting for you to hold marksmanship classes?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Relax, they need some free study time every now and then too.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Also, and I know it goes without saying, but Misery won't get off my back about it—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Be careful, Outcast. Hope it all goes smooth.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Smooth?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Hahah, sorry, kiddo, but that's not me.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: 6:50 A.M. \ Overcast
Interrogation Room, County Hillock of Victoria Barracks, outside corridor
Leader, it's so stuffy in here. There's no ventilation or nothin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You said the same during the Stockton serial bombing interrogation last year.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I'm not gonna be used to it, no matter how many times. You might call Cello instead. With her bein' over two meters, she could scare 'em into behavin' a bit.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You punching a clean hole through a steel table frightens suspects just as much.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Aha, haha... I lost my head for a bit there. He took two children, and then he sat there bein' so sarky about their family. Didn't that steam you as well?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Was I steamed?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You left finger marks in his imprisonment device with how hard you squeezed round his neck. He pissed himself straight on the spot with the shock you gave him, spat his co-conspirator's name and the bomb coordinates right out, all shiverin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That was mostly your credit, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It was a necessary means of interrogation.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Oh, I've never been good with those means. I passed basic interrogation theory by the skin of my teeth. Always copied my friends' homework, as well.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Then you're in luck. Our principal role today is sitting on the side, listening.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: And thank goodness! Actually, um, it's almost time, isn't it? Why's nobody come to bring us in? Didn't that captain tell us it was goin' from 7 o'clock on?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's still four minutes to.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Excuse me, is Captain Kelly present? We're scheduled to meet him here.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I'm not sure.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Is there an interrogation set for seven?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Yesterday afternoon, we had a man suspected of smuggling illegal Originium goods. Do you know where he's being kept?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: That's three strikes...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Well, it wouldn't surprise me if County Hillock keeps slightly different time to Londinium.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Eh, is that a thing?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Seems at least to Captain Kelly it is.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Haha!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I suppose we'll just have to do as the locals do.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It's ten minutes past now.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Checking the time over and over won't bring our colleagues here any faster.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Perfect, in a way. I need to talk with you about that false alarm of a battle yesterday.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Huh? Leader...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You aren't getting one past me. I'm asking you, when I gave the order to withdraw, why did you jump at that crate instead?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Weren't you yellin' for the others to withdraw?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Before we entered the warehouse, you ordered me to make sure to catch the suspect alive.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That was the initial order.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But orders are orders, right?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We all thought the suspect set off a bomb, didn't we? I judged that I was the only one with a chance to complete the mission.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: If I could block the blast wave, I could keep the suspect alive, and you'd all be safe and sound too.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Of course, I had no qualms about your shield, Leader... remember that time you saved me, under all that artillery fire? From the Sargon mercs? 'Cause I'll never forget that.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That's... not what I'm talking about.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: If, and I'm only supposing, there really was a bomb inside that crate, you would've taken grave harm. Possibly even thrown away your life.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Eh? No way. There weren't any explosives that high-spec in the stolen goods. Even if someone modified 'em secretly, the force wouldn't be any harder than the Fortcracker shells we use in combat exercises, y'know?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Heheh, I can take those.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Don't be overly reliant on Vouivran constitution in combat. How many times have I told you that?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Er... five?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Ten at minimum, by my memory. And I can't imagine Slim didn't teach you that too.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Might've... taught me that? Ha, haha...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Your smile-beaming has no effect on me. I'm your leader. I'm responsible for the safety of everyone under me.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Leader...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You know what's coming after we return, don't you?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You can have me run laps, no problem... but I'd hate to go without supper.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: There's times I have no idea how I should handle you, Bagpipe. You're the most outstanding soldier under my command. Your obstinance goes right along with your combat skills... constantly exceeding expectations.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Well, it's got to be that way! My mum told me when I was little, 'Vouivre women must see things through to the end!'
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Not even a hurricane means much of anythin'. If you can't harvest all the wheat before it bogs down, your precious grains'll go all moldy!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I... was not singing your praises.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Forget it. No matter how much I scowl at you...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It'll be a miracle if it reforms you any.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Believe me, Leader, you've got a face far from scary... I've seen plenty enough of the sort with eyes all bright, tellin' people all sinister things with all the worst language Victoria has to offer!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Enough. Meaningless platitudes like this won't affect a qualified Victorian serviceman.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You mean to say...?
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: This... does it have to be this way?
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: Damian... no, I mean Barry. He was a good'un ever since he was young. I can guarantee, he simply took a wrong turn...
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: You're absolutely right.
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: My apologies. Yes, I will follow orders.
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: Yes, those Londiniers are still here...
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: Understood. I'll pass down the instruction, sir.
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: My assurances. I never forget, I am first and foremost... a Victorian soldier.
attributes.name: Captain Kelly

attributes.content: Ugh, Leader, you're checkin' the clock again.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'm not like you. I can't go blank anywhere, anytime.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Honestly speakin', I've had that Feline from the warehouse on my mind. I still properly like the song he sang.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I imagined a bit, dunno why. That song would be lovely for singin' alongside tractorin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: 'The hibernatin' mountains carry livestock herds~'
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: He's starin' at me. Was I singin' out of tune?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You remembered the words wrong.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Oh! Wasn't it livestock? Was it buildin's, then? Or tillers?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You, Hillock pal over there, do you know what this song's words are meant to be?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You shouldn't be singing in here.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Sorry. Did I violate any of your rules?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: At the very least, don't go singing that bunch's songs in front of us.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: That bunch? What bunch? I don't get what you're sayin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Are you fiddling with me, Vouivre?
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Huh? What's got you angry now?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Bagpipe.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Can't shake the feelin' somethin's off-kilter.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You can save it for later.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Uh, I'm not talkin' about... Leader, I think I just heard someone in there singin' as well!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: A matching tune comes from the depths of the dimmed corridor, of a deeper tone, rougher, broken off by a few fierce coughs from time to time.
You think the man's in there?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Hey, you're not allowed in!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Oi! A—Are you the one we caught yesterday in the outskirt warehouse?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... *pant*... D'you mean Damian? Poor Damian... got dragged off ages ago...
attributes.name: Feeble Youth

attributes.content: Eh?! When?! How'd we not hear?!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Where did he get taken to?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Where... ha, haha... you're asking where...
attributes.name: Feeble Youth

attributes.content: He's already... already...
attributes.name: Feeble Youth

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Or would you like to go the same way he went?!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: You're threatenin' him. Why? Where in the world did that man yesterday go to?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Ah... ha... went home.
attributes.name: Feeble Youth

attributes.content: Went... home?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: He got let go? So he had nothin' to do with the spectre force at all? Leader—
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Let me in...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You aren't allowed to converse with the prisoner without permission.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: I want to see Captain Kelly. Step aside, soldier. I know he's in here.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: He is not.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: You? You were the adjutant at the warehouse with the vile mouth, I remember you. What's your idea here?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The Captain left on urgent business. He asked me to pass this on to you—the interrogation ended one hour ago.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Gah...! So you mean, you went and gave us the wrong time?!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: A lapse in communication. Not uncommon at all, is it?
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: What bloody lapse in communication... do you think we're idiots?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Leader, they gave us false info, led us up the garden path!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That's not the key point.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I'm asking you, soldier. Why did you show up to tell us this information now? Since you've bided so much time, surely none of you will mind us wasting even more.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: In regards to your question...
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: (Muttered report)
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Thank you, acknowledged.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Lieutenant Skamandros, the order I received was to inform you of the following—
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Convict Damian Barry, your individual of utmost concern—was, ten minutes ago, in an attempt en route to seize weaponry from his escort and assault military personnel, shot dead.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: What... what bloody nonsense are you feeding us?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We've seen that lad, he's just a normal man! He was frightened stiff when he saw us! How would he go attackin' a fully-armed regular by himself?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That is to say... you summarily executed the suspect without trial.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I have relayed to you the facts.
attributes.name: Adjutant Hill

attributes.content: Leader, we've been put in the dark. Why wouldn't they let us have access to the suspect? Aren't we stood on the same side?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'm still unclear about their reasons right now.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The one thing I can be sure of is, if we want to continue investigating, we've only got ourselves to depend on. The attitude the barracks have is loud and clear—they won't be of any help to us whatsoever.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ugh. I'm not daft, either. I can see they've got a mean habit for trippin' people up.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: So what do we do next? We scarcely got a lead, and it's gone again.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We need to think of some other way.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Oh, yeah! I just thought. That man called Damian, he said his work was sortin' the potatoes.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Every outer agriculture plate in a nomadic city has its own channel for transportin' crops inwards!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We should be able to find the farmworkers' settlement by followin' along. If we can have a chat with his friends or kin, we might find our lead again.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's a very 'you' train of thought.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Then you just leave the information enquirin' to me!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Excellent. We begin immediately.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Leader, are you gonna come with?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'll stay to negotiate with the barracks. To my mind, they wouldn't slop out an execution without going through interrogation. As long as they held one, there'll be records left behind.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Triangle?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Leader, we were in the outskirts—
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: You got ambushed?!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: They came out of nowhere, and I got rumbled...
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: This lot's combat techniques and weaponry, they're a full match with previous intel... even Snare's Arts can barely hit them! Damn it!
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: Remember, your main duty is to come back alive!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Acknowledged, Leader! We should be fine! Triangle, out—
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: This is major intel. Our target, the force they call spectre-like, is in County Hillock this very moment.
attributes.name: Horn
